review_text: Sushi Dan has a nice atmosphere, good date spot, large patio.  The sushi is pretty good.  The lunch special for $9.95 gets you 5 pieces of sushi plus a roll of your choice so pretty large portions.  Miso soup was excellent.  I definitely…

Went to LA for the weekend with a couple of girlfriends. We chose this place to eat and we were we MORE than happy with our decision. It's the best japanese food around. Try ANY of the rolls, and for appetizer, try the calamari.

I normally don't leave bad reviews even when I don't like the restaurant.....I actully like sushi dan.....my boyfriend and I make it a point to go about once a month. But after the last visit we may never go again....the food was good as…

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!THEY HAVE THE BEST SUSHI ESPECIALLY THE "DANNY ROLL" ITS BAKED SUSHI WITH CRAB ADVOCADO AND CUCUMBER MMMMMM!!!!!!\r
THE MISO SOUP AND ENDAMAE IS THE BEST IVE TASTED!!!!!!!!BEEN THERE A COUPLE OF TIMES, ITS NOT THAT…

I'm not typically into sushi (Midwesterner still adopting this Cali favorite) but this place was pretty good.  My friend ordered the items including Tuna, Spicy Tuna, California Roll, and Whitefish -- the Spicy Tuna was great, the rest…

Not a bad place to have a drink, they were decent.  \r
But for the food go somewhere else.  Sushi was not over priced about $12 a roll, but i spent the night heaving in my toilet that was not what i was looking for, all i had was tuna…
cons: poor food, staff will rob you blind, do not tip it is included

Above the Virgin MegaStore atop the Sunset Strip enjoy traditional and fusion sushi at countertop, patio or sports bar.

review_title: A DIsappointing Night Out With My Friends

review_title: Don't go even if it's convenient

review_title: Great place for a dinner party
review_text: I had my 20th birthday dinner at Sushi Dan and was quite pleased.  I made advance reservations and they accomodated around 15 of my friends at no extra service charge.  The service provided was great and the food was good too.  The Danny…

really great sushi, so much to choose from at really good prices... 911 role & hungry role are the best!... parking available in a huge complex and they validate parking also... has a room which has a great view of sunset to dine by...…

review_text: I've been going to sushi dan for a couple of years now and they've never dissapointed me. If they're slow, then that means they're busy. Any normal human being can understand how it feels to be busy if you work somewhere with…

The manager at the Sunset location is hot tempered with the customers because he raised his voice at me when I complained. But its a fact that once all my tables dishes were placed down, we ate everthing seemed like it was going well in…
Me and my sister love this place. Everytime we want sushi this is the place we go to. They already know who we are because of how much we've been there. Always fresh and yummy sushis. Love it!!!!
This place rocks.  The sushi is delicious (always fresh).  The atmosphere is fun and lively and it's very affordable.

We did not have a pleasant dinner experience here.  the newness of the place showed.  the wait staff was awkward and inconsistent.  at first the waiters were overly enthusiastic, hounding us to order when we'd only had 2 minutes to peruse…

review_title: very unique! can't find anywhere elsebut here!

Had a great time ever since my first visit.  Great sushi!  Great selections!  Great ambiance!  It's tops on my list of restaurants to go to.  Lots of fun, and the bartender is cute!
pros: Great sushi, fun environment, good selections

review_text: GREAT sushi one of the best.......higly recommended the baked scallop on ca. roll the best dish there and the dragon roll the yummy crunchy is also great the only place i could eat very good spicy tuna salad highly recommended.

Their wosabi is diluted, and when asked if they had the raw stuff, they didn't. Their Miso soup is too salty, and the quality of their rolls was horrible, and the taste was blande. Overall, if you'd like a bad sushi experience, go here.

We usually make it our business-lunch destination whenever possible.  I am telling you, we have been known to go 3 times in one week.

review_text: I love trying out different sushi restraunts, and I tend to think the price should reflect the taste and quality.  However, I have not found a sushi spot that can beat The Dan.  Just good food.
the food is okay.. but for the price its worth it. service is terrible though.. we only come back for the...

Food is ok for lunch. the lunch specials are cheap but the waiters sometimes creep me out
OUT OF THE 3 SUSHI LUNCH SPOTS ON SUNSET, THIS ONE IS PROBABLY THE BEST. THE INSIDE IS ROOMY AND CLEAN.

review_title: Very Good Japanese Food on Sunset
review_text: This is a family owned and operated business and the quality of the food is excellent.  There is no hype just good food.  Mr. Masa's three boys work behind the Shushi bar and at tables, and his wife is quick to add some little extra to the…
Never get to try their sushi yet but we always come by for lunch for their chicken katsu curry. Great taste and good value
Chicken Teriyaki and steamed rice is one of the best dishes in LA when it comes to Japanese restaurants.

I've been going to Sunset Sushi for a few months, and the lunch specials are really good. They are NEVER busy, always happy to help, and willing to customize your order.

review_title: Very good sushi, salads and soups
review_text: The menu offers reasonable priced sushi combo plates, nicely decorated and freshly prepared. Choose a combo and get a wide variety of Asian specialties served on a tray. The combos include diverse spicy soups, eclectic fish salads,…

review_title: Combos provide plenty of food at reasonable prices
review_text: Visitors on the Sunset Strip snack on sushi, tempura, teriyaki and other traditional Japanese cuisine at the bar inside this tiny, wood-paneled dining room. In addition to the regular menu, a handful of combo specials are also offered on…
Great Sushi for below average prices. I like the simplicity of the food. The rolls are simple and tasty.
